chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The key parts on which the Panifex Platform is based on are OSGI and ZK framework.

OSGI framework is a module system and service platform for Java programming language which enables a dynamic and wholesome model for components. Its main feature is the needlessness of rebooting while installing, starting, stopping, updating or uninstalling applications or components which, deployment-wise, come in the form of bundles. The mentioned main feature is possible due to APIs that allow remote downloading of management policies and enable the management of an application development. Bundles are, thus, enabled to detect the addition or removal of services, and to adapt accordingly.

The latter key part of Panifex, ZK framework, is a Java-written open source Ajax Web application framework designed for easy writing of graphical user interfaces for Web applications. To put it briefly, it is a Java framework for building Web enterprise and mobile applications with little programming knowledge.
